alert.note: Alert for Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 4:04PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware...and southern New Jersey... including the following counties...in northern Delaware...New Castle. In southern New Jersey...Salem. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 403 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Scattered showers and thunderstorms will continue impacting the advisory area through this evening. A Flash Flood Warning has been issued for portions of central and southern New Castle County. Remain alert for any additional advisories or warnings. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Wilmington, Newark, Pennsville, Carneys Point, Elsmere, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Newport, Arden, Wilmington Manor, and Delaware Memorial Bridge. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 1 and 20. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 5. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
